alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 24 at 1:33AM CDT until September 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Oklahoma, including the following county, Okfuskee. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Clusters of strong thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall will continue across Okfuskee county early this morning. Rainfall amounts overnight in the 2 to 4 inch range will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
